verbose_text: Hence, amantadine doses must be reduced in patients with renal dysfunction to avoid toxicity.4 So far, amantadine intoxication has only been reported in patients with renal failure.5, 6, 7 However, the aim of this study is to report our clinical experience with a patient who developed toxic symptoms due to an increase in blood amantadine concentration during the combined use of donepezil, while being diagnosed with cerebral infarction and moderate renal dysfunction.
evidence: amantadine doses must be reduced in patients with renal dysfunction to avoid toxicity.4
